article:
Our children grew up on peanut butter and jelly sandwiches, although my husband and I sometimes sneak one late at night with a glass of milk. I believe that the success of this   _  loved
concoction  lies not in the brand of peanut butter,   but rather  in the jelly. The right jelly  _  the
plate, and homemade is the only choice.
My mother-in-law was the jelly maker in this family. This limited choice was a welcome    _  in the days of toddlers, siblings and puppies. All I did was to  _  baby food jars, which my mother-in-law would seal with wax  and    _  back
home with us.  _  I wanted to make a peanut butter and
jelly sandwich , all I had to do was reach for one of little jars. Jelly making
was just a way of  _  for my mother-in-law. She always
did it, setting the  _  jelly on the shelves .
My father-in-law died several years ago and this past December, she also    passed away  . Among the things
in the house to be divided by her children were the  _  canned
goods.
The other day I reached my pantry  for jelly for a quick sandwich. Sitting all alone on the far side of the shelf was a small jar of grape jelly, whose lid was   _  in places.  _  on
it were "GR" for grape and the year when the jelly was made.
As I picked up the jar, I suddenly realized something that I had    _  to see
earlier. This was the last jar we would ever have from the  _   ,loving hands . We hardly ever opened a jar of jelly at table without  _  about those thousands of little jars she had filled. It seems like
such a small thing, and most days it was something that was  _  for
granted.
No longer was it just a jar of jelly. It was the end of a family   _  . We have hundreds of
pictures and many more memories that we expect to  _  the
years and to pass on to our children. The jar of jelly won't keep that long. It
will either have to be eaten or  thrown out  ...but not today.
